main event: On May 22, 1956, a bright golden object, the size of a pea held at arm's length, was sighted in Amarillo, Texas. The object appeared to be hovering and remained in approximately the same location for one and a half hours.
interesting points: The object was reported to have a bright golden color and was round in shape.
The sighting occurred when the observer was taxiing lawn and saw a B-47 overhead, following which the unidentified object was sighted at a 45Â° angle within a specific azimuth range.
The observation was made by a 35-year-old refrigerator maintenance man and a housewife, indicating civilian witnesses.
The Commanding Officer of the 69th ACHS Squadron reported that the object was identified as a weather balloon at 15,000 feet by a military aircraft on a routine training mission.
The weather and wind conditions at the time of the sighting included broken clouds with winds at different altitudes, and there were nearby thunderstorms.
